Material used.Description: A mouse Neuro2a cell and a human embryonic kidney cell line 293T cells (293T) were maintained in Dulbecco's supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum at 37 Â°C under 5% CO2.

Readout description.Result Description: Used to confirm down regulation of endogenous DJ-1 with siRNA-expressing vector after 48 h of transfection.

Biological replicates.Description: All above results were confirmed by three independent experiments.

Basic negative control.Description: As negative controls, siRNA-expressing vectors expressing shuffled siRNA sequence were used.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Expression levels comparable to control without stress.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Expression levels reduced by more than 90% compared to control.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Cell Death Assessment (Trypan Blue Exclusion and LDH Assay)

Material used.Description: Neuro2a or 293T cells in 24-well culture plates were transfected with DJ-1 siRNA vector or pEGFP-DJ-1.

Readout description.Result Description: Over-expression of L166P mutant DJ-1 did not rescue cell death induced by oxidative stress (H2O2), ER stress (tunicamycin and thapsigargin), or proteasome inhibition (lactacystin), unlike wild-type DJ-1. At lower concentrations of stressors, L166P mutant showed a toxic effect.

Biological replicates.Description: All above results were confirmed by three independent experiments.

Basic positive control.Description: Over-expression of wild-type DJ-1 was used as a positive control for rescue of cell death.

Basic negative control.Description: siRNA-expressing vectors expressing shuffled siRNA sequence were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Statistical significance reported with p-values (e.g., p < 0.01, p < 0.001, p < 0.05).

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cell death levels comparable to control without stress.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant increase in cell death compared to control under stress conditions (e.g., p < 0.01).

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Hoechst Dye Staining for Nuclear Condensation

Material used.Description: Cells with nuclear condensation were counted under a fluorescence microscope in 15-30 min after application of 1.0 mM Hoechst dye (33258).

Readout description.Result Description: Nuclear condensation of Neuro2a cells by Hoechst dye staining was much reduced by over-expression of wild-type DJ-1, but not by that of L166P mutant DJ-1 under oxidative stress.

Biological replicates.Description: All above results were confirmed by three independent experiments.

Basic positive control.Description: Over-expression of wild-type DJ-1 reduced nuclear condensation.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Statistical significance reported with p-values (e.g., p < 0.01, p < 0.001).

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Minimal nuclear condensation comparable to unstressed control cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant increase in nuclear condensation compared to control (p < 0.01).
